tossups.question: This city was blockaded after its leader hit Pierre Deval with a fly whisk. One side in this war accomplished its first ever naval victory in the Battle of Gangut, while the final, decisive naval battle in this war was the Battle of Grengam. This city’s Parian district is often regarded as the world’s first Chinatown. This dynasty employed religious militia called the Ikhwan, or brothers, and this dynasty were early converts to the teachings of Abd al-Wahhab. This dynasty conquered Hejaz to gain custody of Islam’s two holiest places. This composer’s 8th string quartet begins with a motif symbolizing his own name. After this composer received a government denunciation, he described his next symphony as a “response to just criticism.”Another of this composer’s works includes a repeating ostinato called the “Invasion Theme” and was named for a city “that Stalin destroyed and Hitler merely finished off.” For the point, name this Soviet composer of Lady Macbeth of the Mtsensk District and the Leningrad symphony.

During this event, Armand du Paty de Clam faked a hand injury to obtain a writing sample from a suspect. Alabama while overturning Betts v. Brady. The defendant in this case was arrested after allegedly breaking into a Florida pool hall. Along with Wednesday, Eastern Orthodox Christians traditionally abstain from animal products on this day of the week, and Roman Catholics originally abstained from meat on this day. On this day of the week, Muslims gather for the Jumu’ah prayer service. For the point, give this day of the week on which Jesus’s crucifixion is commemorated, celebrated by Christians as “Good.”

Lake Franklin Delano Roosevelt was created on this river by the completion of the Grand Coulee Dam. The Snake River is a tributary of, for the point, what large river in the Pacific northwest?

The nobility in this country was known as szlachta [sh’lock-ta], and many were murdered by peasants in the Galician slaughter. tossups.question: Andrew Beckett, a lawyer who suffers from this disease, is played by Tom Hanks in the 1993 film Philadelphia. Biswanath Sardar was hung for leading a revolt over growing this cash crop, which was incentivized with large loans called “dadon.” Benjamin Franklin sailed on the U.S.S. Reprisal with 35 barrels of this commodity to negotiate with France. After rice, this commodity became the second largest cash crop grown in South Carolina, following its popularization by Eliza Pinckney. The Battle of Karameh failed to completely eliminate this political party, thanks to the tactics of its fedayeen guerillas.
